availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Crossland (Hickman County, Kentucky, lawyer and colonel (C.S.A))

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, attorney and colonel (C.S.A). Hickman County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Adaline Hess Crossland in Gibson County, Tennessee, on March 2, 1847. Father of Elizabeth Crossland, Samuel H. Crossland, Kate Crossland, and Jeff D. Crossland. Sheriff in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hickman County from 1857 to 1859. Attorney in Clinton in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) as captain, major, and lieutenant colonel from April 23, 1861, to May 25, 1862. Served in the 7th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as colonel from May 25, 1865, to May 1865. Attorney in Mayfield in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 503.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 207A.
Confederate Veteran, vol. 19 (Nashville, Tennessee: S. A. Cunningham, 1911), 366.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
"Edward Crossland (1827-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial #19431, accessed June 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19431.
Tennessee State Marriages, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Gibson County Marriages.
